content:
This statement is currently quite confusing.

"This game must have exactly 3 players. They decide to team up in trios and play the game. After each game the trios are rearranged. Sometimes there will be some players that will not be able to play in each round of games. But, if everyone can play in each round of games, that day is called a Lucky Day."

It might be clearer if you say:
"They decide to team up in trios and play multiple games simultaneously in rounds."

Not a bad clash once you can figure it out, but in my clash I was the only human to get above 0%.
Unfortunately I got 80% because of Validator 3. I had 100% on the tests, but I was using factorials and "nCr = n!/(r!(n-r)!)" which had an issue for n = 3 since "n-r=0" and my factorial was poorly defined for 0.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks like a fun problem, well-defined, good test cases, and involves a little combinatorics, not something I see too often in these problems.
I edited this for grammar and clarity. Also made the >= a ≥. Looks like a nice problem, I agree that reverse would be too hard, but this will be great for fastest and shortest, nice work!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A well-defined problem which is simple to implement, or to learn how to implement using combinatorial functions. Requires useful and non-trivial skills. Tests account for edge cases. Constraints well-defined. Implementation is straightforward, once you know how to solve.
This needs a constraint N>=1, or a test which accounts for N=0

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Elle permet de travailler les rudiments de la combinatoire

Goal section
* Please format "Lucky Day" / "Not a Lucky Day" as constants e.g. {{Lucky Day}}.

Output section
* Same comment as above.

Game modes
* Too difficult to guess the requirement in Reverse mode.

Thanks.
Updated: Removed the reverse mode and also change the formatting

A few more formatting changes in the Goal section to be done :wink:

And {{N}} should be changed to [[N]] too.

Variables and constants are still mixed up.
Curly brackets are for {{constants}}.
Square brackets are for [[variables]].
So please change {{N}} to [[N]] in Goal section and Input section. Thanks.
